articles.title: Budget 2025 Time: When Will FM Nirmala Sitharaman Present Union Budget 2025? All Details Here
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: Budget 2025 Time: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Union Budget for the fiscal year 2025, marking a significant event on India‚Äôs economic calendar. This year‚Äôs presentation will be her eighth consecutive Budget speech, making her the first Finance Minister in the country‚Äôs history to reach this milestone. With signs of an economic slowdown looming, the upcoming Budget is anticipated to unveil strategic measures aimed at revitalising growth and reforming the tax framework.When Will Budget Presentation Begin?Sitharaman will present the budget today at 11:00 am.The Parliamentary Budget session kicked off on January 31, 2025. The session is being conducted in two phases: the first part runs from January 31 to February 13, while the second segment is scheduled between March 10 and April 4.During this period, the Government will outline its financial agenda and policies, which are expected to influence economic developments in the coming year.How To Watch LiveThose keen on catching the live presentation can do so through various online and broadcast platforms. The Union Budget website (indiabudget.gov.in) and Sansad TV‚Äôs YouTube channel will provide live streaming.Watch Union Finance Minister Smt. @nsitharaman present the Union Budget 2025-26 in Parliament üëá‚è∞ 11.00 amüóìÔ∏è 1st Feb. 2025üì∫ https://t.co/XpqpDftox9Stay tuned and watch out for LIVE updates onüëáX ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/76gY97bOzRFacebook ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/GVfVncuCDS‚Ä¶‚Äî Ministry of Finance (@FinMinIndia) January 31, 2025ABP News will also offer comprehensive live TV coverage, while ABP Live will share real-time updates and expert analysis throughout the day.Sitharaman‚Äôs Record-Setting BudgetThis Budget marks a historic moment for Sitharaman, who surpasses several notable predecessors, including Manmohan Singh and Arun Jaitley, in the number of Budget presentations.Appointed as India‚Äôs first full-time female Finance Minister in 2019, she has introduced significant reforms during her tenure. Notable highlights include the introduction of the simplified tax regime in 2020 and her decision to replace the traditional Budget briefcase with a ‚Äòbahi-khata‚Äô (traditional ledger) in 2019, symbolizing a shift toward Indian traditions.Since 2021, the Union Budget has gone completely digital, a move aligned with the Government‚Äôs push for transparency and environmental sustainability. Citizens can access Budget documents and updates online, enhancing public access to financial information.What to Expect This Year The 2025 Union Budget comes at a critical juncture as India faces challenges such as slowing GDP growth. Analysts anticipate reforms targeting increased public investment and policies aimed at stimulating economic activities. Possible changes to personal and corporate tax structures are also being speculated.Given the current economic scenario, Sitharaman‚Äôs speech will be closely watched for initiatives that could shape India‚Äôs economic roadmap. As the nation looks forward to recovery and sustainable development, the Union Budget 2025 is expected to outline strategies to navigate challenges and pave the way for future growth.Whether viewed live or followed through timely updates, this year's Union Budget promises to be a pivotal moment that could influence the financial landscape for years to come.

articles.title: Gold Rate Today (February 1): Check Out Gold Prices In Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Ahmedabad, More Cities
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: Gold Prices Today: India, the second-largest gold consumer globally after China, has a strong demand for gold, met primarily through imports and locally recycled bullion. Domestic gold prices are influenced by various factors, including taxes, the value of the dollar, import duties, bond returns, and global gold prices (denominated in dollars). Many investors see gold as a hedge against inflation.Here Are The Latest Gold Rates Across 10 Major Cities In India:Gold Rate In Delhi TodayThe current gold rates in Delhi stand at Rs 7,746 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,449 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Chennai TodayThe current gold rates in Chennai stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Bengaluru TodayThe current gold rates in Bengaluru stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Mumbai TodayThe current gold rates in Mumbai stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Pune TodayThe current gold rates in Puna stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Kolkata TodayThe current gold rates in Kolkata stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Ahmedabad TodayThe current gold rates in Ahmedabad stand at Rs 7,736 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,439 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Hyderabad TodayThe current gold rates in Hyderabad stand at Rs 7,731 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,434 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Indore TodayThe current gold rates in Indore stand at Rs 7,736 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,439 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold Rate In Lucknow TodayThe current gold rates in Lucknow stand at Rs 7,746 per gram for 22-karat gold and Rs 8,449 per gram for 24-karat gold (commonly known as 999 gold).Gold prices for 22k and 24k have been rising steadily in India, reinforcing its status as a dependable asset. With its reputation for stability, gold remains a preferred investment option for those looking for reliable returns.

articles.title: Chhattisgarh reports first case of HMPV; 3-year-old boy tests positive
articles.description: A three-year-old boy from Korba district has been diagnosed with Chhattisgarh's first human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection. Tests at AIIMS Raipur confirmed the infection, prompting his transfer to an ICU and potential further treatment. Health officials have issued an alert and are monitoring his siblings while conducting a survey in the locality.

articles.title: ‚ÄòNot Like-For-Like Replacement‚Äô: Buttler Frustrated Over Harshit Rana's Substitution For Shivam Dube As Concussion Sub
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: India defeated England by 15 runs in the IND vs ENG 4th T20I in Pune on January 31 (Friday) to gain an unassailable 3-1 lead and win the five-match series. Shivam Dube and Harshit Rana were the standout players for India. However, Rana, who was not initially a part of the playing 11 played the game as a concussion substitute for Shivam Dube, leading to a huge controversy. India brought in Harshit Rana as a concussion substitute for Shivam Dube, who couldn't take the field after being struck on the helmet late in the first innings. Rana made an immediate impact when he bowled for the first time in T20Is in the 12th over. With England at 94/3 while chasing 182, Rana struck a crucial blow by dismissing Liam Livingstone, who had been instrumental in England‚Äôs comeback victory in the previous game at Rajkot. Rana eventually ended with figures of 3-33 in 4 overs,'We Disagree With The Decision': Jos ButtlerFormer cricketer Kevin Pietersen and England captain Jos Buttler raised concerns over India‚Äôs move of replacing Rana with Dube, questioning its legitimacy. Buttler also stated that he was not consulted regarding the substitution."It is not a like-for-like replacement. We don't agree with that. Either Shivam Dube has put on about 25mph with the ball or Harshit has really improved his batting. It's part of the game and we really should have gone on to win the match, but we disagree with the decision,‚Äù Buttler said after the India vs England 4th T20I."There was no consultation [with us]. That's something I was thinking as I came out to bat - who is Harshit on for? They said he is a concussion replacement, which I obviously disagreed with. It is not a like-for-like replacement. They said that the match referee had made the decision. We had no say in it or any part of it. But we'll ask Javagal [Srinath] some questions just to get some clarity around it,‚Äù he added."Like I said, it was not the whole reason why we did not win the match. We had our chances to win the game which we could have still taken. But I'd like to have a bit more clarity on that.‚ÄùPietersen also took issue with Rana's inclusion, questioning how a specialist fast bowler could be allowed to replace an all-rounder as a concussion substitute."Jos Buttler got out in frustration because he was not happy with the substitution. Ask anybody in the world if Harshit Rana is a like-for-like replacement. I am not so sure that anybody would say that he is. I think that there is going to be a very big discussion if Harshit Rana picks up four for nothing. It is a different matter if he is like-for-like or not, but an entirely different discussion if they can turn this into their strength," Pietersen said while commentating.

articles.title: Watch: Chhattisgarh's Mutvendi village gets its first school under CM's 'Niyad Nellanar' scheme
articles.description: Mutvendi village in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district celebrates its first-ever school after decades, thanks to the Niyad Nellanar scheme by Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai. The initiative aims to develop villages near security camps in five districts. Additionally, a bagless learning model was introduced in Balrampur, and Chilkapalli village received electricity for the first time.

articles.title: Commercial LPG price slashed by Rs 7; check new rates
creator: TOI BUSINESS DESK
articles.description: Oil marketing companies have reduced the price of commercial LPG gas cylinders by Rs 7, with the 19-kg cylinder now costing Rs 1,797 in Delhi. This follows a previous reduction on January 1. Additionally, aviation turbine fuel prices dropped by 1.5%, or Rs 1,401.37 per kilolitre. The price cut is the first after five consecutive hikes.

articles.title: No travel reimbursement for US troops seeking abortion, fertility treatment
articles.description: The Defence Department will no longer reimburse service members for travel out of state to get reproductive health care, including abortions and fertility treatments, according to a new memo.The directive signed this week eliminates a rarely used Biden administration policy enacted in October 2022, after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade and more states began to impose increased abortion restrictions.Signed on Wednesday by Jeffrey Register, the director of the Pentagon's human resources department, the memo simply shows red lines crossing out the previous regulation and offers no other guidance.Asked if service members would still be allowed time off to travel at their own expense, the department had no immediate answer.Sen. Elizabeth Warren, D-Mass., a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, called the policy change shameful.Our service members go wherever they need to in order to bravely serve our country and because President Trump's extremist Supreme Court

articles.title: CDC Data Removal Sparks Controversy Over Gender Identity Guidance
articles.description: CDC Data Removal Sparks Controversy Over Gender Identity Guidance The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, alongside other federal health agencies, have confirmed the removal of web pages featuring HIV statistics and related data in adherence to directives from the Trump administration. This policy change, focusing on gender identity and diversity, has raised alarm among healthcare professionals and advocacy groups.Key resources taken down include statistics concerning HIV among transgender individuals and health disparities within LGBTQ+ youth populations. A corresponding database tracking behaviors that elevate health risks for young people is also offline following orders from President Donald Trump to recognize only male and female sexes and eliminate diversity programs.Health and Human Services Department representatives mentioned that compliance necessitates removing any online references to gender identities beyond biological sex. Critics, including the Infectious Diseases Society of America, warn that such actions compromise essential scientific information needed for effective health monitoring and disease outbreak responses.

articles.title: Why timing matters
creator: Ritambhara Bhalla
articles.description: Many couples are choosing to marry in their 30s due to career and financial considerations. articles.title: Philly Plane Crash: Small Aircraft Crashes Near Roosevelt Mall On Cottman Avenue...
creator: Aradhana Brahma
articles.description: Authorities in Northeast Philadelphia reported that an aircraft crashed Friday night near Roosevelt Mall shortly after six o'clock in the evening. Police discovered the suspected plane accident near Roosevelt Mall, which is situated at Roosevelt Boulevard and Cottman Avenue. There were several victims, according to the police, and the mall was being evacuated.
